# 

# Take A Museum Tour  

__

## Historic Downtown Walking Tours

Learn more

### Historic Downtown Walking Tours

Walking tours of historic Petaluma led by costumed docents. Come hear the history of Petaluma from the mouths of early settlers of Petaluma. Most Saturdays, May through October, meet on the steps of the Museum at 10:30 a.m. to begin. Reservations should be made through Eventbrite from our Events Page – Cost is free, but donations are appreciated!

__

## Customized Group Tours

Learn more

### Customized Group Tours

For museum visits; if you are a group of 10 or more we ask that you make advanced reservations with the museum before visiting. There is a $5 fee per person. Contact  
[kgreenspan@petalumamuseum.org](mailto:kgreenspan@petalumamuseum.org)

 __

## School Tours

Learn more

### School Tours

Offered to all third-grade classes as part of the Social Studies curriculum. Includes a visit to the Museum and a short walk around Historic Downtown Petaluma. Contact  
[kgreenspan@petalumamuseum.org](mailto:kgreenspan@petalumamuseum.org)  
for information. No charge to participating schools.

# We value your feedback and support

If you want to contact the Petaluma Historical Library and Museum please feel free to reach out to us. Your comments or questions to the Petaluma Museum are welcome.

Donations are Welcome!

Please fill out the form below to send...

# _“Preserving the Unique History of Petaluma and Providing Educational and Cultural Services to the Community”_

## BECOME A MEMBER

Our members allow us to carry out our mission to preserve the unique history of Petaluma and provide educational and cultural services to the community. Join today and receive benefits such as gift shop and event discounts, advanced access to exhibits, and a subscription to our quarterly newsletter.

[Join](/join)

# 

# Take A Virtual Tour of the Petaluma Museum

Best viewed Full Screen. To read what is on the wall click on the picture to enlarge it for reading.

## READ OUR NEWSLETTER

The museum publishes a quarterly newsletter with interesting historical articles and photographs, as well as information on current and upcoming exhibits.

[GO TO NEWSLETTERS](/newsletter)
